intro: Terminalia neglecta, commonly known as the African snowball tree, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its smooth, pale bark and clusters of white, fleshy flowers that appear at the ends of branches, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland forest areas. Terminalia neglecta is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
